text: following instructions intended employees city Zurich working Windows computer. Instructions operating systems currently available. HelveticaNeueLTPro must ordered software center installed computer. make available, important copy font-related files C:\Program Files\Common Files\Adobe\Fonts c:\windows\Fonts. font’s system path used font_add() function showtext package order import font make accessible R. family parameter used plotting within ssz_theme() function. creating graphic, recommended invoke showtext_auto() graphic text rendered using showtext. resolution graphic controlled using showtext_opts(dpi = 300).
code: # install.packages("rappdirs") # install.packages("showtext") library(extrafont) library(rappdirs)  path_to_font <- file.path(user_config_dir(roaming = FALSE, os = "win"), "Microsoft", "Windows", "Fonts")  font_add(family = "Helv",          regular = file.path(path_to_font, "HelveticaNeueLTPro-Roman.ttf"),          bold = file.path(path_to_font, "HelveticaNeueLTPro-Hv.ttf"))           showtext_auto() showtext_opts(dpi = 300)

title: showcase how to create ggplots with styling according to the city of Zurich
text: ssz_theme(...) function take styling tasks CI/CD city Zurich prescribes. Namely, position axis titles well spacing ten thousand numbers (see picture ) still need additional manual adjustment.

title: showcase how to create ggplots with styling according to the city of Zurich
text: ggplot2 axis titles positioned relative axis tick labels. zueritheme means e.g. y-axis titles positioned top left y-axis, right-justified axis tick labels.  Since position axis titles therefore depends scaling (length strings categories) displayed variable, title must positioned margin(r = ...) addition theme() function order conform corporate design. axis title right-justified aligned axis labels. example set right-margin -27. value right margin axis title example adjusted -27 looks something like :
code: ggplot(...) +   geom_bar(...) +   ssz_theme(grid_lines = "y") +   theme(axis.title.y = element_text(     margin = margin(t = 0, r = -27, b = 0, l = 0)   ))

what: Spacing for the Ten Thousand Numbers
title: showcase how to create ggplots with styling according to the city of Zurich
text: order get nice spacing ten thousand numbers, need format labels big.mark = " " applying scale_y_continuous function (scale_x_continuous numeric values shown x axis).
code: ggplot(...) +   geom_bar(...) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = function(x) format(x,                                                 big.mark = " ",                                                  scientific = FALSE),                     ...) +   ssz_theme(grid_lines = "y")
